item.title: Gadwal killers inspired by Meghalaya murder: Cops
item.description:
<![CDATA[HYDERABAD: Taking inspiration from the Meghalaya honeymoon murder case, CANFIN Bank Manager V Tirumal Rao and Aishwarya planned the murder of the latter’s husband, G Tejeshwar. According to the police, Tirumal Rao and Aishwarya believed that certain mistakes were made by the accused in the Meghalaya case, and if those mistakes were avoided, they too could eliminate Tejweshwar and settle either in Ladakh or the Andaman and Nicobar Islands.
The Gadwal police on Thursday arrested all the eight acc...]]>
item.author: Express News Service

item.title: GPS tracker on bike, cash in hand, killers on call: Mother-daughter love triangle ends in husband’s killing in Telangana; chilling details of Gadwal murder
item.description:
<![CDATA[Victim tracked with GPS before killing
From plot to kill his own wife to murdering her husband
Killers posed as land buyers, lured victim to isolated spot
Gang paid Rs 3.5 lakh; body shown to mastermind before disposal
Vehicle check busts escape plan
T Sahasra alias Ishwarya, wife of the victim and co-conspirator
Tirupataiah, 64, Rao’s father and a retired APSP constable, who helped him hide
Sujatha, Ishwarya’s mother, who was aware of the plot
A Mohan, 30, a mason from Jammiched village...]]>

item.title: Telangana Murder: How wife’s affair with boss led to husband’s murder; new details emerge in Gadwal case
item.description:
<![CDATA[
HYDERABAD: Jogulamba Gadwal police on Thursday arrested eight people, including a newly-wed woman and her lover, for the abduction and murder of 32-year-old land surveyor Ganta Tejeshwar on June 17.Police said the murder was plotted by V Tirumala Rao, 35, manager at Can Fin Homes Ltd in Kurnool, and his lover Sahasra alias Aishwarya, 23, Tejeshwar's wife. They roped in a gang with promises of cash and favours to execute the plan. All eight were sent to judicial remand. Police plan to seek cu...]]>
item.author: Tnn
